scn_base_frr_scn_01.name: Notifications
scn_base_frr_scn_01.description: FedRAMP SCN > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_base_frr_scn_01.instructions: Providers MUST notify all necessary parties when Significant Change Notifications are required, including at least FedRAMP and all agency customers. Providers MAY share Significant Change Notifications publicly or with other parties.

scn_base_frr_scn_02.name: Procedures and Documentation
scn_base_frr_scn_02.description: FedRAMP SCN > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_base_frr_scn_02.instructions: Providers MUST follow the procedures documented in their security plan to plan, evaluate, test, perform, assess, and document changes.

scn_base_frr_scn_03.name: Evaluate Changes
scn_base_frr_scn_03.description: FedRAMP SCN > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_base_frr_scn_03.instructions:
Providers MUST evaluate and type label all _significant changes_, then follow FedRAMP requirements for the type.


Technical Assistance:
Once a change has been identified as a _significant change_ in general, FedRAMP recommends next determining if a change is of the type _routine recurring_. If it is not, work down from the highest impact to lowest to identify the type of change.

1. Is it a _significant change_?
2. If it is, is it a _routine recurring_ change?
3. If it is not, is it an _impact categorization_ change?
4. If it is not, is it a _transformative_ change?
5. If it is not, then it is an _adaptive_ change.

scn_base_frr_scn_04.name: FRR-SCN-04
scn_base_frr_scn_04.description: FedRAMP SCN > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_base_frr_scn_04.instructions: Providers MUST maintain auditable records of these activities and make them available to all necessary parties.

scn_base_frr_scn_05.name: FRR-SCN-05
scn_base_frr_scn_05.description: FedRAMP SCN > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_base_frr_scn_05.instructions: Providers MUST keep historical Significant Change Notifications available to all necessary parties at least until the service completes its next annual assessment.

scn_base_frr_scn_06.name: FRR-SCN-06
scn_base_frr_scn_06.description: FedRAMP SCN > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_base_frr_scn_06.instructions: All parties SHOULD follow FedRAMP's best practices and technical assistance on _significant change_ assessment and notification where applicable.

scn_base_frr_scn_07.name: FRR-SCN-07
scn_base_frr_scn_07.description: FedRAMP SCN > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_base_frr_scn_07.instructions: Providers MAY notify necessary parties in a variety of ways as long as the mechanism for notification is clearly documented and easily accessible.

scn_base_frr_scn_08.name: FRR-SCN-08
scn_base_frr_scn_08.description: FedRAMP SCN > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_base_frr_scn_08.instructions: Providers MUST make ALL Significant Change Notifications and related audit records available in similar human-readable and compatible _machine-readable_ formats.

scn_base_frr_scn_09.name: FRR-SCN-09
scn_base_frr_scn_09.description: FedRAMP SCN > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_base_frr_scn_09.instructions: Providers MUST include at least the following information in Significant Change Notifications:

scn_base_frr_scn_10.name: FRR-SCN-10
scn_base_frr_scn_10.description: FedRAMP SCN > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_base_frr_scn_10.instructions: Providers MAY include additional relevant information in Significant Change Notifications.

scn_routine_recurring_frr_scn_rr_01.name: FRR-SCN-RR-01
scn_routine_recurring_frr_scn_rr_01.description: FedRAMP SCN > Routine Recurring. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_routine_recurring_frr_scn_rr_01.instructions: Providers SHOULD NOT make formal Significant Change Notifications for _routine recurring_ changes; this type of change is exempted from the notification requirements of this standard.

scn_adaptive_frr_scn_ad_01.name: FRR-SCN-AD-01
scn_adaptive_frr_scn_ad_01.description: FedRAMP SCN > Adaptive. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_adaptive_frr_scn_ad_01.instructions: Providers MUST notify all necessary parties within ten business days after finishing _adaptive_ changes, also including the following information:

scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_01.name: FRR-SCN-TR-01
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_01.description: FedRAMP SCN > Transformative. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_01.instructions: Providers SHOULD engage a third-party assessor to review the scope and impact of the planned change before starting _transformative_ changes if human validation is necessary. This review SHOULD be limited to security decisions that require human validation. Providers MUST document this decision and justification.

scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_02.name: FRR-SCN-TR-02
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_02.description: FedRAMP SCN > Transformative. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_02.instructions: Providers MUST notify all necessary parties of initial plans for _transformative_ changes at least 30 business days before starting _transformative_ changes.

scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_03.name: FRR-SCN-TR-03
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_03.description: FedRAMP SCN > Transformative. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_03.instructions: Providers MUST notify all necessary parties of final plans for _transformative_ changes at least 10 business days before starting _transformative_ changes.

scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_04.name: FRR-SCN-TR-04
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_04.description: FedRAMP SCN > Transformative. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_04.instructions: Providers MUST notify all necessary parties within 5 business days after finishing _transformative_ changes, also including the following information:

scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_05.name: FRR-SCN-TR-05
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_05.description: FedRAMP SCN > Transformative. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_05.instructions: Providers MUST notify all necessary parties within 5 business days after completing the verification, assessment, and/or validation of _transformative_ changes, also including the following information:

scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_06.name: FRR-SCN-TR-06
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_06.description: FedRAMP SCN > Transformative. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_06.instructions: Providers MUST publish updated service documentation and other materials to reflect _transformative_ changes within 30 business days after finishing _transformative_ changes.

scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_07.name: FRR-SCN-TR-07
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_07.description: FedRAMP SCN > Transformative. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_transformative_frr_scn_tr_07.instructions: Providers MUST allow agency customers to OPT OUT of _transformative_ changes whenever feasible.

scn_impact_frr_scn_im_01.name: FRR-SCN-IM-01
scn_impact_frr_scn_im_01.description: FedRAMP SCN > Impact. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_impact_frr_scn_im_01.instructions: Providers MUST follow the legacy Significant Change Request process or full re-authorization for _impact categorization_ changes, with advance approval from an identified lead agency, until further notice.

scn_exceptions_frr_scn_ex_01.name: FRR-SCN-EX-01
scn_exceptions_frr_scn_ex_01.description: FedRAMP SCN > Exceptions. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_exceptions_frr_scn_ex_01.instructions: Providers MAY be required to delay _significant changes_ beyond the standard Significant Change Notification period and/or submit _significant changes_ for approval in advance as a condition of a formal FedRAMP Corrective Action Plan or other agreement.

scn_exceptions_frr_scn_ex_02.name: FRR-SCN-EX-02
scn_exceptions_frr_scn_ex_02.description: FedRAMP SCN > Exceptions. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
scn_exceptions_frr_scn_ex_02.instructions: Providers MAY execute _significant changes_ (including _transformative_ changes) during an emergency or incident without meeting Significant Change Notification requirements in advance ONLY if absolutely necessary. In such emergencies, providers MUST follow all relevant procedures, notify all necessary parties, retroactively provide all Significant Change Notification materials, and complete appropriate assessment after the incident.
